results.title: Thursday & Friday
results.creator_credit: Bruce Forrest, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When there was not enough food on the ground to feed the cattle, Bruce Forrest had to create his own ‘Meals on Wheels.’

results.title: Ants in the irrigation drippers
results.creator_credit: Jeanette Holloway, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In 1976, Jeanette and Arthur Holloway took over Arthur’s family farm in Chiltern, Victoria. There they began a partnership with two other families to grow kiwi fruit. Jeanette Holloway recounts the time there, the hardships and how the farm became her home.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeanette Holloway, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: In 1976, Jeanette and Arthur Holloway took over Arthur’s family farm in Chiltern, Victoria. There they began a partnership with two other families to grow kiwi fruit. Jeanette Holloway recounts the time there, the hardships and how the farm became her home.

results.title: Rangipukea
results.creator_credit: Vanessa James, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Vanessa James talks about the island just off the end of the farm that her family used to own. There they would farm sheep and cattle over the years and throughout the generations.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Vanessa James, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Honore et labore
results.creator_credit: Rhonda Diffey, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Rhonda Diffey attended her high school reunion, she met two ex-students Frank Spik and Win Ellis both from classes of 1916 and 1915 respectively. Their stories have instilled in Diffey a glimpse into the past and a sense of pride in her school.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rhonda Diffey, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Robert's story [Subtitled]
results.creator_credit: Robert Weston, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
A trip down memory lane for Robert Weston as he reminisces about family, his childhood, fishing and hunting, and living on the land in the bush.
In English language with English subtitles.

results.title: I'm home
results.creator_credit: Ron Briggs, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Identity is the most important thing to Ron Briggs. He talks about his father, his family and the traumatic experiences of being part of the stolen generation which separated him not only from his parents but also from his siblings.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ron Briggs, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Identity is the most important thing to Ron Briggs. He talks about his father, his family and the traumatic experiences of being part of the stolen generation which separated him not only from his parents but also from his siblings.

results.title: From the beginning to the resistances
results.creator_credit: Mick Edwards, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: ‘Me, my family, my nan - my mob.’ This is Mick Edwards’ story of separation, of a stolen generation or in Edwards’ words, “the kidnapped generation” and of healing and family and reunion.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mick Edwards, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Streets of Fitzroy [Subtitled]
results.creator_credit: Mick Booth, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Mick Booth was brought up in Kent Street, Fitzroy - an inner suburb of Melbourne. This is his story of childhood memories, family and growing up in Fitzroy.
In English language with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mick Booth, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description:

results.title: A Life in community
results.creator_credit: Than Van Nguyen, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Arriving in Australia as a refugee from Vietnam, Than Van Nguyen has dedicated his life to community involvement and the Vietnamese community, with his principal goal being ‘solidarity, unity, being united’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Than Van Nguyen, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
